subject: RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?
msgSnippet: Please don t attribute that quote to me.  It belongs to Chuck Herrick. I m the one he s calling thin-skinned for thinking that charging Kent and Erich with
messageBody:
Please don't attribute that quote to me. It belongs to Chuck Herrick.
I'm the one he's calling thin-skinned for thinking that charging Kent
and Erich with releasing untested code was unwarranted criticism.

- George

-----Original Message-----
From: Joi Ellis [mailto:joi@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 27, 2001 12:42 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?


On Tue, 27 Mar 2001, Dinwiddie, George wrote:
> 3. I'm as grateful as the next bloke to Erick and Kent for JUnit. That
said,
> I'm hardly going to mute criticism where I feel that criticism is
warranted.
> Pointing this stuff out is how software gets better. If Erick and Kent are
> as thin-skinned as you are, and I certainly hope they are not, they'll
take
> a gentle pointer to a bug trend in the spirit in which it is offered.

"Gentle?" You sure didn't write your posts as if you were grateful!

Your past messages were so rude and arrogant I may just to go to
the trouble of configuring procmail on my box just to get rid of you.
You sure haven't done a thing to make ME want to help you out. Why should
Kent and Erich want to do so?

I've had my own issues with Junit, and in some cases I've posted examples
of difficulties I've experienced, and in other cases I've posted patches
that actually fix them or enhance JUnit in some other way.

Instead of bitching out everyone here, why don't you try contributing
to the effort like the rest of us?

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
